original_title: Sri Lanka UDA hopes to earn Rs21bn from land sales over three years: report
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Urban Development Authority hopes to earn 21 billion rupees over the next three years by selling land to investors, the Government Information Department said in a social media post.
This year the UDA hopes to earn 9 billion rupees, the report said.

The lands related to these projects are located in the areas of Colombo Fort, Warakapola, Galukotuwa, Avissawella, Thalawathugoda, Kottawa, Ekala, Mahanuwara, Narahenpita, Nawalapitiya, Balangoda, Kolonnawa, Wellawatta, Padukka, the facebook.com post of the information office said.
The land is available for under long-term lease for public private partnerships. (Colombo/Jan9/2024)
